conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to determine the path each liquid will take from its starting point (A, B, C, D) through the barriers and into one of the containers (E or F).
A is green, B is orange, C is white, and D is blue.
A starts at the top left.
A flows downwards between the yellow and pink barriers.
A bounces off the bottom left barrier.
A heads towards the left container (E).
B starts at the top center left.
B flows downwards between the yellow and pink barriers.
B bounces off the bottom left barrier.
B heads towards the left container (E).
C starts at the top center right.
C flows downwards between the orange and white barriers.
C bounces off the bottom right barrier.
C heads towards the right container (F).
D starts at the top right.
D flows downwards along the rightmost path.
D bounces off the bottom right barrier.
D heads towards the right container (F).
A and B both end up in the left container (E).
C and D both end up in the right container (F).
The liquids from A and B will flow into container E, while the liquids from C and D will flow into container F.
